thread.title: Kate Upton a beauty in gold at MusiCares event in LA | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: Kate Upton a beauty in gold at MusiCares event in LA | Daily Mail Online

author: Dailymail.Com Reporter
title: Kate Upton a beauty in gold at MusiCares event in LA | Daily Mail Online
text: comments Kate Upton can't help but command the spotlight, wherever she may be. The 24-year-old beauty on Friday was snapped walking the red carpet at the 2017 MusiCares Person of the Year in Los Angeles, California, where rock n' roll icon Tom Petty was honored in front of a room full of luminaries to kick off Grammys weekend. The Other Woman actress was a vision of glamour and beauty at the swanky party, as she wore an elegant golden gown with a creme top that wrapped around her neck, revealed her shapely shoulders. Simply irresistible: Kate Upton, 24, lent her dazzling presence to the red carpet of the 2017 MusiCares Person of the Year on Friday in Los Angeles, California, where Tom Petty was being honored Picture perfect: No matter what direction she's facing, the supermodel always looks amazing Stunning smile: Upton teamed a cream halterneck with long gold skirt The St. Joseph, Michigan native, who is dating Detroit Tigers pitcher Justin Verlander, was perfectly made up for the occasion with a fresh face with very subtle makeup. She wore her blonde locks up as she hit a number of precise modeling poses, as photographers snapped away. The 5ft10 fashionista was one in a parade of famous faces to attend the lavish proceedings, which also welcomed Fleetwood Mac songstress Stevie Nicks, 80s rockers The Bangles, Electric Light Orchestra front man Jeff Lynne and country music legend George Strait, among many others. Young'un: The superstar model was born in 1992, a year after Petty released his album Into the Great Wide Open, which featured standout songs such as the title track and the song Learning to Fly Icon: Rihanna wasn't there, but Rhiannon singer Stevie Nicks was. The voice of the legendary band Fleetwood Mac supported her classic rock colleague on his big night Living legend: ELO frontman Jeff Lynne, Petty's Traveling Wilburys band mate, posed with gorgeous girlfriend Camelia Kath on the red carpet Bros: Occasional Beach Boy John Stamos posed on the red carpet with Howard Stern producer Gary Dell'Abate, who has detailed his passion for music in his 2010 book They Call Me Baba Booey Also in attendance were prominent personalities not directly associated with the music business, such as California Congresswoman Nancy Pelosi, Howard Stern producer Gary Dell'Abate, Australian model Nicole Trunfio and actors Wilmer Valderrama and John Stamos, the latter of whom has sat in as drummer for The Beach Boys on occasion for more than three decades. The event, according to organizers , aimed 'to provide essential support for MusiCares, which ensures music people have a place to turn in times of financial, medical, and personal need.' The Free Fallin' singer was being honored on Friday for not just his iconic music catalog, organizers said, but 'his career-long interest in defending artists' rights, and the charitable work he has undertaken throughout his career, which has notably focused on the homeless population in Los Angeles.' Just another frantic Friday: The Bangles members (left to right) Susanna Hoffs, Vicki Peterson and Debbi Peterson matched in black at the extravagant event Showman: Country music stalwart George Strait looked elated to be at the event honoring the I Won't Back Down singer Dapper: Hollywood lothario Wilmer Valderrama kept warm on the rainy night in a dark outfit Gorgeous: Australian model Nicole Trunfio had a leg up on others in her elegant white gown Share or comment on this article Most watched News videos
